summary: This document consists of three Bureau of Prisons memoranda from August 12, 2019, reassigning Correctional Officer Tova Noel to restricted duties and limiting her access to the first floor of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The memos were issued shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the same facility.

keyFacts: Correctional Officer Tova Noel was reassigned to restricted duties on August 12, 2019, just days after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
Noel's access within the prison was restricted to the first floor only, indicating she was removed from regular inmate housing or monitoring duties.
The memoranda were issued by a prison Captain and directed to both Noel and the Control Center, formalizing the restriction of a staff member's movement.
Noel's normal schedule was Wednesday through Sunday, with Monday and Tuesday off, which may be relevant to the timeline of events surrounding Epstein's death.
